title: [K-12] Early Mathematical Image Formation: Quantitative Thinking-Based Instructional Design for Language Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic arithmetic operations and ability to apply everyday numerical concepts
context.additional_context: Emphasis on non-visual interactions optimized for smartphone-based learning environments. Analysis of cognitive processing of quantitative expressions in language learning contexts

learning_goals: Learners can combine linguistic imagery with quantitative situations encountered in daily life and explain them with 80% accuracy
Learners can demonstrate their mathematical thinking process during clinical interviews conducted weekly over four weeks and incorporate corrective feedback
Learners can record and compare image transformation processes using diverse tools (fingers, verbal counting, visual representations) in a longitudinal experimental setting

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
